Article Title: TCS cuts variable pay of senior staff for July-September quarter: What the company has to say
Article Text:
How TCS pays variables to staff

What the company has to say

Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) has reduced variable pay for some employees in the July-September quarter, a report has said, adding that the cuts have hit even those who have complied with the company's work-from-office policy.Citing sources close to the matter, Moneycontrol reported that while some employees received only 20-40% of their quarterly variable pay, others received no variable pay at all. This marks a significant drop from the 70% payout in the previous quarter.In April 2024, TCS revised its attendance policy, mandating a minimum of 85% office attendance for employees to receive their full variable pay. Employees with lower attendance rates receive a reduced percentage of their variable pay, with those below 60% ineligible for the bonus.TCS links variable pay to office attendance as well as it also depends on the performance of individual business units. The report also said that the recent cuts reflect the challenging demand environment and economic uncertainties that have led to slower growth for major IT services companies in the second quarter.In Q2, India's largest IT services company reported a 5.5% year-on-year revenue growth in constant currency terms.“We expect the headwinds to stabilise in Q3 and return to growth in Q4,” the company told analysts in its post-earnings call last month.A TCS spokesperson clarified that junior-level employees received 100% of their quarterly variable allowance (QVA). However, for other grades, the QVA is based on their unit's business performance, consistent with the company's usual practice.“For Q2FY25 we have paid out 100% QVA to junior grades across the company. For all other grades, the QVA depends on their unit’s business performance. This is in line with our standard practice across quarters,” a TCS spokesperson was quoted as saying.
Article Summary: Tata Consultancy Services ( TCS ) has reduced variable pay for some employees in the July-September quarter. Cuts have hit even those who have complied with the company's work-from-office policy. In April 2024, TCS revised its attendance policy, mandating a minimum of 85% office attendance.

Article Title: Elon Musk joins Donald Trump on his 25-minute phone call with Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, and why it matters
Article Text: Elon Musk participated in US President-elect Donald Trump 's congratulatory call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Wednesday, signalling the tech billionaire's growing influence in Trump's incoming administration, according to Axios.During the 25-minute call, Musk assured Zelenskyy that Ukraine would continue receiving support through his Starlink satellite network, which has been crucial for Ukraine's military communications throughout the war with Russia, Axios reported.The call marked Trump's first contact with Zelenskyy since winning the presidential election. Sources briefed on the conversation told Axios that while specific policy details weren't discussed, the Ukrainian president found the timing of the call encouraging and was not left feeling anxious about Trump's victory.Musk's presence on the high-level diplomatic call follows reports of his substantial campaign contribution of $119 million to Trump and speculation about a potential cabinet position in the upcoming administration.The SpaceX CEO was also present during Trump's call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, where it was revealed the two were having dinner together.Despite Trump's campaign promises to quickly broker peace between Russia and Ukraine, sources say the president-elect did not delve into specific plans during Wednesday's call. Zelenskyy later acknowledged in Budapest that while Trump desires a swift end to the conflict, they hadn't discussed detailed proposals.The relationship between Musk and Ukraine has been complex, with the tech entrepreneur previously drawing criticism for mocking Ukraine's requests for aid and proposing his own peace plan in 2022. However, his Starlink technology remains vital to Ukraine's war effort.The billionaire's involvement in high-level diplomacy comes as The Wall Street Journal revealed his regular communications with Russian President Vladimir Putin since late 2022. Trump has yet to speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin since the election, though Putin has indicated he would accept a call from the president-elect.
Article Summary: Musk assured Zelenskyy that Ukraine would continue receiving support through his Starlink satellite network. The SpaceX CEO was also present during Trump's call with Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdoğan, where it was revealed the two were having dinner together. Trump has yet to speak with Russian President Vladimir Putin since the election.

Article Title: Onix unveils Kingfisher and Phoenix solutions to solve data challenges, accelerate AI adoption
Article Text:
How Onix’s news solutions will help AI adoption

How Kingfisher and Phoenix work

Onix has launched two AI-powered products aimed at solving the data-related challenges that large tech companies are currently facing. These include data scarcity, privacy concerns and the complexities of AI implementation.The cloud-native IT company that provides services in data, cloud and AI solutions modernisation has unveiled Kingfisher , a synthetic data generator, and Phoenix, an AI-powered business intelligence framework. The latest solutions join its Birds product suite aimed at streamlining AI-powered business intelligence.During a conversation with journalists on the sidelines of Onix's inaugural Annual Day, company CEO Sanjay Singh along with CTO Niraj Kumar talked about tech companies' reliance on AI for growth has skyrocketed the demand for high-quality, compliant data.They noted that as organisations struggle to navigate the complexities of deploying and managing AI systems effectively, Onix's Kingfisher and Phoenix tackle these challenges, providing businesses with powerful tools to unlock the full potential of AI.“Kingfisher and Phoenix aren’t just products—they’re transformative solutions that enable enterprises to innovate at scale with absolute confidence in data privacy and efficiency,” said Singh, adding that the solutions provide privacy.As per Kumar, Kingfisher addresses the need for secure and privacy-compliant data by generating synthetic data that mirrors the characteristics of real data without compromising sensitive information. He explained that this AI-powered solution analyses production code and identifies edge cases to create comprehensive datasets that are statistically identical to real data, enabling risk-free development, testing, and AI/ML model training.After the synthetic data is created, Phoenix simplifies the process of extracting meaningful insights from data, and by leveraging AI-powered automation, Phoenix enables real-time, conversational data querying and delivers intuitive, explainable insights.When asked how Onix’s approach is different from other tech giants, Singh explained that the company differentiates itself in the industry by leveraging AI and data modernisation. He highlighted their unique approach to data migration and integration, focusing on building a contextual understanding of the data landscape to enable AI-driven solutions.As per Kumar, while Kingfisher solves scarcity issues while protecting sensitive information ethically, Phoenix simplifies AI deployment, enabling enterprises to harness powerful models without the usual complexities.When asked about bias and privacy about the generated synthetic data, Kumar told The Times of India Tech that “the notion of synthetic data generation is to take care of the ethical area.”“Otherwise what will happen? It will expose all real data to the users even though you have used it for training purposes. Hence, all the access privileges are defined, so we protect the data and implement all policies, privileges and roles, and the user groups accordingly,” he explained.For example, even if an AI chatbot is trained on data related to credit card numbers, when asked through LLM or natural language, it will only give users the answer if you have privileged access to it. Otherwise, it will say, “I'm not able to give because you don't have access to it”.
Article Summary: Onix has launched two AI-powered products aimed at solving the data-related challenges that large tech companies are currently facing. These include data scarcity, privacy concerns and the complexities of AI implementation. The cloud- native IT company that provides services in data, cloud and AI solutions modernisation has unveiled Kingfisher and Phoenix.

Article Title: Donald Trump win: Nvidia becomes first tech company to make this 'record' beating Apple
Article Text:
Representative Image

Where do Apple, Microsoft stand

Musk’s net worth surged by $26.5 billion

Nvidia's stock soared to new heights, taking the chipmaker to a historic milestone. The US-based chipmaker’s company's market capitalisation surpassed $3.6 trillion, making it the first ever to achieve such a valuation. Reportedly, this surge comes soon after the market was fueled by the recent re-election of Donald Trump as the US President.As per news agency Reuters, Nvidia's shares rose 2.2% on Thursday (November 7), driven by expectations of potential policy changes that could favour the tech industry. This is not the first time that Nvidia has overtaken both Apple and Microsoft, it recently surged ahead of the tech giants to become the most valued company.In June, Nvidia briefly became the world's most valuable company before it was overtaken by Microsoft and Apple. The tech trio's market capitalisations have been neck-and-neck for several months.This achievement essentially solidifies Nvidia's position as a dominant force in the semiconductor industry, particularly in the rapidly growing field of artificial intelligence (AI) – beating tech giants like Google and other heavyweights working on the same technology.It is not just Nvidia that had its worth jump exponentially – Elon Musk's net worth also surged by $26.5 billion after Trump’s victory in the US elections. Article Title: World's richest 'techie' prisoner shares the tips that other inmates and guards at jail asked him for
Article Text:
Binance founder on Elon Musk

Binance founder Changpeng Zhao claims that his “felon status” hasn’t discouraged people from doing business with him. In a recent interview with Bloomberg, Zhao recounted how he initially went unrecognized in prison, but his reputation for wealth and expertise in crypto soon attracted attention.Zhao pleaded guilty to anti-money laundering charges in 2023. He was sentenced to prison in April, becoming the richest-ever US inmate. He served a four-month sentence at a minimum-security prison in California and was released earlier this year in September.Recalling inquiries from fellow inmates and prison guards, he said “Many of them asked me which coins they should buy”. He said that he would often tell others, "I don’t have access to any information. I don’t even know what the market looks like."When Zhao was still CEO, Binance invested $500 million in Elon Musk’s takeover of Twitter, now known as X. Since then, the value of the social-media platform has declined. Commenting on the direction Musk has taken X, he said “I think after Elon took over, things have moved a lot faster at Twitter. There’s new features, change happens at a much faster pace. I’m not too concerned about the value of the investment going up or down. We’re very long-term investors.”

Narayana Murthy and Sudha Murty on The Great Indian Kapil Show: A journey of love and mutual respect

Deepinder Goyal and Grecia Munoz: The Zomato experience and cultural connection

Sudha Murty’s return to The Kapil Sharma Show

Fans’ reactions and excitement

Also read

For the first time in Indian television history, two influential power couples from the worlds of technology, business, and philanthropy will grace The Great Indian Kapil Show . This weekend’s much-anticipated episode will feature NR Narayana Murthy and Sudha Murty, the celebrated founders of Infosys and well-known philanthropists, alongside Zomato co-founder Deepinder Goyal and his wife, Mexican model Grecia Munoz (Gia Goyal). A recent teaser released by Netflix has already generated significant excitement, providing a glimpse into the candid, humorous, and heartwarming moments that await viewers. Hosted by comedian Kapil Sharma, the episode is set to showcase personal stories, cultural exchanges, and anecdotes from the lives of these remarkable personalities.In the teaser, NR Narayana Murthy, 78, reflects on his initial meeting with a young Sudha Murty, recalling the profound impact she had on him. Describing her as “a breath of fresh air,” Murthy shared his admiration for her intelligence, kindness, and dedication to social causes. Now married for 47 years, the couple has become one of India’s most respected duos, with Sudha Murty achieving acclaim as an author, Rajya Sabha member, and philanthropist.When Kapil Sharma humorously questioned whether their habits have grown similar over the years, Sudha Murty responded with her characteristic humor and honesty. “I became a workaholic like him and a stickler for time,” she shared, adding, “I cook so badly, but he never complains. Look at Murthy saab's weight — that's thanks to my cooking!” The playful exchange between the Murthys highlighted their mutual respect and understanding, as well as Sudha’s humility and humor about her culinary skills.The episode also introduces Deepinder Goyal, co-founder of Zomato, and his wife, Grecia Munoz, who he married earlier this year. Known for her vibrant personality and background in modeling, Grecia has embraced her role alongside Deepinder, even immersing herself in Zomato’s operations. During the show, Goyal shared an amusing story about how he and Grecia surprised Zomato customers by delivering orders themselves in Gurgaon. The reaction of customers, who were surprised and delighted by Grecia’s appearance at their doorsteps, quickly became the highlight of the conversation.“When Gia delivers the order, the customers can’t help but keep staring,” Goyal laughed, prompting a burst of laughter from the audience and Kapil Sharma. The couple’s chemistry and lighthearted attitude have made them popular among Zomato’s users and the public, with fans appreciating Grecia’s willingness to engage directly with Goyal’s business and her adaptation to Indian culture.This is not the first time Sudha Murty has appeared on Kapil Sharma’s platform. Last year, she joined The Kapil Sharma Show alongside filmmaker Guneet Monga and actress Raveena Tandon, where she shared personal anecdotes about her life and experiences. The audience was captivated by her wisdom and humility, as she recounted stories from her travels, including a memorable instance at an airport where she was labeled “cattle class” for wearing traditional attire. Sudha used humor to narrate her response, underscoring her pride in her cultural roots and her unshakeable confidence.In addition to her philanthropic and literary contributions, Sudha Murty’s previous appearance also revealed her admiration for Bollywood legends such as Shah Rukh Khan and Dilip Kumar, bridging the worlds of Indian cinema and literature.The teaser release has already stirred excitement among fans, who are eager to see the contrasting yet complementary dynamics of these two couples. While the Murthys are admired for their contributions to India’s technology and education sectors, Deepinder and Grecia have gained popularity as a young, modern couple who represent the global, interconnected nature of today’s India.Social media platforms have been abuzz with comments from viewers looking forward to the episode, with many expressing admiration for Sudha Murty’s humility and wit, and curiosity about Grecia’s adaptation to life in India. Fans also anticipate candid moments and stories from the lives of the Murthys and the Goyals, hoping for inspiring takeaways from both the established and next-generation leaders in India’s entrepreneurial landscape.
Article Summary: This weekend’s episode will feature NR Narayana Murthy and Sudha Murty, the celebrated founders of Infosys and well-known philanthropists. The episode also introduces Deepinder Goyal, co-founder of Zomato, and his wife, Grecia Munoz. A recent teaser released by Netflix has already generated significant excitement.

Article Title: Baltasar Ebang Engonga’s 400 leaked sex tapes: Videos with wives of senior government officials and others create stir
Article Text:
Baltasar Ebang Engonga’s sex tape scandal

Attorney General initiates health and privacy investigation

Vice President Teodoro Nguema calls for accountability

Public reaction and rising scrutiny

Equatorial Guinea’s Director General of the National Financial Investigation Agency (ANIF), Baltasar Ebang Engonga , is at the centre of a scandal following the leak of explicit videos allegedly involving him in intimate encounters with multiple individuals. Originally investigated for alleged fraud, Engonga now faces public backlash and intensified scrutiny over his professional conduct and personal life. This controversy has sparked widespread reaction on social media and raised questions regarding ethics, public responsibility, and potential health risks associated with his actions. As the scandal unfolds, government authorities have initiated an official investigation, underscoring the increasing call for accountability among public officials in Equatorial Guinea.The scandal began when investigators, initially looking into Engonga for suspected fraud, reportedly discovered over 400 videos on his computer depicting private interactions with various individuals. These encounters allegedly involved multiple partners, including his brother’s wife, a cousin, and a relative of the President. According to sources, the videos were filmed in locations such as Engonga’s office, hotels, and even restrooms, with all recorded interactions believed to be consensual.Once leaked, the videos rapidly circulated across social media, sparking outrage and debate among citizens. Public response to the videos has varied, with many questioning the ethical standards of a high-ranking public official engaging in such activities, while others raised concerns about the privacy breach that led to the leak. Posts across social platforms criticised the conduct of a figure responsible for financial investigations, with some users highlighting the discrepancy between his public role and personal actions.In response to the viral scandal, Equatorial Guinea’s Attorney General’s Office, led by Anatolio Nzang Nguema, launched an official investigation into the circumstances surrounding the video leak. According to a spokesperson, authorities are assessing whether Engonga’s actions may have posed health risks, which could result in additional charges if confirmed.“If proven, he could face charges for endangering public health,” the spokesperson commented, emphasising that the investigation will extend beyond the videos themselves to assess any potential impact on public health.This probe into health risks marks a significant expansion of the investigation, as the Attorney General’s office examines both the privacy concerns involved in the leak and the broader implications of Engonga’s behaviour on public welfare. The investigation is expected to review the conduct of government officials and enforce measures to maintain accountability.In a public statement, Vice President Teodoro Nguema took to X (formerly Twitter) to address the scandal, emphasising the need for accountability among public officials. Nguema noted that government offices must be strictly reserved for official duties, signalling disapproval of the misuse of government resources and office spaces for personal purposes.Nguema announced that the government would be implementing new, stricter policies to ensure that misconduct within the administration is met with serious disciplinary action. He further stated that officials found guilty of misusing their authority or resources could face termination or other consequences as deemed appropriate. This stance reflects a broader governmental shift towards enforcing ethical standards and reinforces the message that public officials will be held responsible for their actions, especially when it comes to misuse of office privileges.Engonga, a married man and father of six, holds a prominent position at ANIF, leading financial investigations and initiatives against corruption. However, his involvement in the leaked videos has placed his career and reputation under intense public scrutiny. The scandal has opened a wider debate on the expectations placed on public officials, with many citizens questioning whether private conduct should impact public responsibility and ethical standards.As public opinion continues to weigh in, some have called for Engonga’s resignation, while others argue that privacy should protect personal matters unless they directly impact professional duties. The case has ignited a conversation on the balance between privacy and public accountability, particularly when it comes to those in leadership roles within the government.
Article Summary: Equatorial Guinea’s Director General of the National Financial Investigation Agency, Baltasar Ebang Engonga, is at the centre of a scandal following the leak of explicit videos. The scandal began when investigators, initially looking into Engonga for suspected fraud, reportedly discovered over 400 videos on his computer depicting private interactions with various individuals. This controversy has sparked widespread reaction on social media and raised questions regarding ethics, public responsibility, and potential health risks associated with his actions.

Article Title: How Elon Musk’s $130 million became $26 billion in one flat day
Article Text:
How the other 9 in the Top 10 richest list do after Donald Trump's victory

Elon Musk's net worth surged by $26.5 billion after the victory of Republican candidate and former president Donald Trump in the US elections. Musk, the world's richest person, has been one of Trump's largest supporters. Reports suggest that Elon Musk donated around $130 million to Donald Trump's campaign as well as supporting him on his social media platform X (earlier Twitter).While Tesla CEO Elon Musk may not have planned it. But his support for Donald Trump has done wonders to his net worth. According to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index , Musk's net worth grew to $290 billion post the US election results. Reason: the surge in his companies' stock price.Musk's Tesla saw a 15% increase in its share price which adds to Tesla's already impressive performance, with shares up 32% over the past year. Musk, a supporter of the president-elect, is expected to play a role in policy decisions, further boosting investor confidence in Tesla.Alongside Musk, the fortunes of the other nine individuals in the world’s top 10 richest list also saw a record daily surge as Donald Trump secured a second term as president.As per Bloomberg’s Billionaires Index, the net worth of the world's wealthiest individuals surged by a record $63.5 billion, fueled by a post-election rally in US stocks. Apart from Musk, Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and Oracle's Larry Ellison were also among the top gainers.This surge in wealth also extends to other tech billionaires, including crypto leaders Brian Armstrong of Coinbase and Changpeng Zhao of Binance. Armstrong’s net worth increased by 30% to $11 billion while Zhao’s Binance added $12.1 billion post the US election which boosted his net worth to $52.7 billion.The surge in wealth is also attributed to market optimism following the US election, with investors anticipating lower taxes and deregulation under the new administration.The S&P 500 also experienced its best post-election performance in history, jumping 2.5%, while the US dollar also strengthened.
Article Summary: Elon Musk's net worth surged by $26.5 billion after the victory of Donald Trump in the US elections. Musk, the world's richest person, has been one of Trump's largest supporters. Reports suggest that Musk donated around $130 million to Donald Trump's campaign as well as supporting him on his social media platform X.

Article Title: Netflix offices raided in joint operation by French and Netherlands’ authorities
Article Text:
FILE PHOTO: The Netflix logo is shown on one of their Hollywood buildings in Los Angeles, California, U.S., July 12, 2023. REUTERS/Mike Blake/File photo

French and Dutch authorities raided Netflix offices in Paris and Amsterdam on Tuesday, November 5, as part of an investigation into alleged tax fraud and concealed employment, according to French judicial sources.The searches, conducted by France's National Financial Prosecutor's Office (PNF) and corruption investigators, stem from a preliminary investigation opened in November 2022 into suspected " laundering of aggravated tax fraud " and "concealed work in an organised gang."The raids follow scrutiny of Netflix's tax declarations between 2019 and 2020, when the company's reported French revenue appeared inconsistent with its subscriber base of approximately 7 million users. According to French media outlet La Lettre, Netflix Services France paid just €981,000 ($1.06 million) in corporate taxes for 2019-2020.Netflix's declared turnover in France increased dramatically after 2020, rising from €47.1 million ($51.3 million) to €1.2 billion ($1.3 billion) in 2022, suggesting the company may have previously used tax optimization strategies through its Dutch (Netherlands) subsidiary.The simultaneous searches at Netflix's European headquarters in Amsterdam were conducted through cooperation between French and Dutch authorities that has been ongoing for several months, officials said.This is not Netflix's first tax-related issue in Europe. In 2022, the streaming giant paid €55.8 million ($59.1 million) to settle a tax dispute with Italian authorities.Netflix, which opened its Paris office in 2020 and employs around 40 staff there, has not responded to requests for comment on the raids. The company produces several original series in France, including the hit show "Emily in Paris."A preliminary investigation in France does not necessarily lead to criminal charges or a trial.
Article Summary: French and Dutch authorities raided Netflix offices in Paris and Amsterdam on Tuesday, November 5. Raids follow scrutiny of Netflix's tax declarations between 2019 and 2020. Netflix Services France paid just €981,000 ($1.06 million) in corporate taxes for 2019-2020.

Article Title: Google’s Project Jarvis leaked on Chrome Web Store: How this AI agent can take over web browsing
Article Text:
What is Google’s Project Jarvis



Google’s experimental AI assistant, codenamed "Jarvis," has been reportedly leaked to the public through the Chrome Web Store. According to a report by The Information, the Chrome Web Store page for Jarvis describes it as a "helpful companion that surfs the web for you." The prototype was briefly available on the Chrome Web Store before being taken down by the company. While the leaked version was not fully functional, its description hinted at advanced capabilities like web browsing and task automation.Google is planning to reveal Jarvis in December. The AI assistant is expected to compete with rivals like Anthropic's Claude, which can perform complex tasks such as typing text and controlling a computer's cursor. While Google has not officially announced Jarvis, its accidental appearance on the Chrome Web Store offers a glimpse into the company's ongoing AI development efforts. It remains to be seen when or if Jarvis will be officially released to the public.This AI prototype goes beyond basic tasks like setting reminders or checking the weather, offering more advanced capabilities like browsing the web and completing tasks such as buying groceries, booking flights, and conducting research. This suggests a more sophisticated level of AI assistance than what is currently available in mainstream virtual assistants.Jarvis is designed to streamline web-based tasks by integrating with the Chrome browser. It can analyse web pages, interpret user instructions, and perform actions like clicking buttons and typing text, though its speed is currently being optimised.Jarvis joins a growing field of AI-powered automation tools being developed by tech giants like Microsoft (Copilot Vision), Apple (Apple Intelligence), Anthropic (Claude), and OpenAI (ChatGPT). These tools aim to simplify digital tasks and enhance productivity through natural language interaction and automated actions.While Jarvis shows promise in its ability to automate web-based tasks, its final form and public availability remain uncertain. As AI technology advances, we can expect more sophisticated tools that will transform our digital interactions and workflows.
Article Summary: Google's experimental AI assistant, codenamed "Jarvis," has been leaked to the public. The prototype was briefly available on the Chrome Web Store before being taken down. Jarvis is designed to streamline web-based tasks by integrating with the Chrome browser. It can analyse web pages, interpret user instructions, and perform actions like clicking buttons and typing text.

Article Title: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos: Two 'most-popular' drama series on Netflix India in fiscal 2024 were ...
Article Text:
Most popular drama series and movies on Netflix India in fiscal 2024

Netflix India , the streaming giant's local subsidiary, has reported a 49% increase in net profit to Rs 52 crore for the fiscal year ending March 2024. This growth was fueled by a 29% rise in gross revenue to Rs 2,845 crore, driven by a growing subscriber base and the successful launch of mobile-specific plans. Netflix India’s gross turnover rose 29% to Rs 2,845 crore from Rs 2,214 crore in FY23, boosted by a growing subscriber base, show its financial data sourced by business intelligence platform Tofler.During the company's recent earnings calls, global executives highlighted India as a key market for subscriber growth and revenue. During the third-quarter earnings call, Co-CEO Greg Peters said that markets like India exemplified Netflix’s decade-long investment in local creative communities, partnering with storytellers to help them deliver compelling narratives to audiences.During Netflix's second-quarter earnings call, the company highlighted India as the second-largest market globally for paid net subscriber additions in the June-ended quarter and third in revenue percentage growth.With an estimated 12 million subscribers, Netflix, according to Media Partners Asia, is said to be India's largest pure-play streaming service. The company's recent success can be attributed to its increased focus on local content. Sarandos highlighted that Heeramandi , directed by Sanjay Leela Bhansali, was Netflix India’s biggest drama series, with 15 million views. The platform also disclosed that Amar Singh Chamkilaachieved 8.3 million views, while licensed films like Laapataa Ladies and Shaitaan also contributed to subscriber growth."Our original films and licensed films, including those released in the pay-TV window following theatrical releases, continue to thrill our members,” Sarandos said in July.Netflix surpassed Wall Street's expectations for both earnings and revenue in its latest quarterly report, adding 35 million paid global subscribers year-over-year. This strong performance follows months of subscriber growth attributed to the introduction of a cheaper ad-supported plan and the crackdown on password sharing.
Article Summary: Netflix India reported a 49% increase in net profit to Rs 52 crore for the fiscal year ending March 2024. This growth was fueled by a 29% rise in gross revenue to Rs 2,845 crore. Article Title: Zomato and Swiggy are allegedly violating India’s competition law, here’s what the complaints are
Article Text:
What CCI investigation found out

Food delivery platforms Zomato and SoftBank-backed Swiggy have allegedly violated competition laws. India's antitrust watchdog, the Competition Commission of India (CCI), has reportedly discovered that Zomato and Swiggy engaged in practices that violate competition laws. According to a report by the news agency Reuters, documents have revealed that business practices of these popular food delivery platforms favour select restaurants listed on their platforms. The report cited some documents prepared by the CCI (which are not available to the public) to claim that Zomato offered lower commissions to restaurants that signed exclusivity agreements, while Swiggy guaranteed business growth to certain restaurants that listed exclusively on its platform. These practices are seen as anti-competitive and potentially harmful to smaller restaurants and consumers. The CCI's findings could lead to penalties and corrective measures for both Zomato and Swiggy.The investigation launched in 2022 reportedly started after a complaint by the National Restaurant Association of India. This complaint highlighted the impact on food outlets of the alleged anti-competitive practices of Swiggy and Zomato.While the CCI report remains confidential, its findings were shared with Zomato, Swiggy, and the National Restaurant Association of India, which filed the initial complaint.Zomato's shares fell 3% following the report. The CCI case is also listed as an “internal risk” in Swiggy's IPO prospectus, highlighting the potential for substantial penalties. The report also noted that Swiggy plans to launch a program similar to its discontinued " Swiggy Exclusive " (Swiggy Grow) in non-metropolitan cities, raising further concerns about potential anti-competitive practices.The CCI also reportedly found that Zomato imposed pricing and discount restrictions on restaurant partners, while Swiggy threatened to lower the rankings of restaurants that did not maintain price parity.The CCI is currently reviewing the investigation's findings and will make a final decision on any penalties or required changes to Zomato and Swiggy's business practices.
Article Summary: India's antitrust watchdog, the Competition Commission of India (CCI), has reportedly discovered that Zomato and Swiggy engaged in practices that violate competition laws. The investigation launched in 2022 reportedly started after a complaint by the National Restaurant Association of India. The CCI's findings could lead to penalties and corrective measures.

Article Title: How worried China and Taiwan's chip industries are preparing for Donald Trump’s return to White House
Article Text:
China races to stockpile chip equipment

Taiwan's semiconductor sector on edge

CHIPS Act future remains uncertain

China's semiconductor industry is gearing up for Donald Trump 's return to the White House by accelerating equipment purchases and exploring new talent recruitment strategies, according to industry experts and documents reviewed by Reuters.The aggressive preparation comes as Trump, who previously targeted Chinese tech giants Huawei and SMIC with trade restrictions, is expected to take an even tougher stance on China's chip ambitions in his second term. Industry experts told Reuters that Chinese firms are significantly better prepared this time, having learned crucial lessons from Trump's first presidency.Chinese manufacturers have particularly focused on acquiring lithography machines, with imports surging 35.44% to $7.9 billion in the first nine months of 2023, Chinese customs data reveals. The majority of these machines came from the Netherlands, valued at $7 billion, before new restrictions took effect.Companies have maximised equipment orders to hedge against future restrictions. Chinese chip maker Jinan Lujing Semiconductor Co's emphasis on self-reliance echoes a broader industry sentiment, noting that Trump's first term had already highlighted "the necessity of localization.""Chinese tech companies have progressively expanded their production capacities to mitigate future risks," Nori Chiou, investment director at Singapore-based White Oak Capital Partners, told Reuters.The Beijing Semiconductor Industry Association is advising companies to seize potential opportunities if global coordination on chip sanctions weakens under Trump. "There could be benefits to China's semiconductor industry in terms of professional talents, multinational companies and foreign cooperation," said Zhu Jing, the association's deputy secretary-general, in a WeChat post.The situation has created ripples in Taiwan, where semiconductor giant TSMC faces uncertainty about its global operations. Despite growing concerns, Taiwan's leader William Lai Ching-te projected confidence on Wednesday, stating that "the long-standing Taiwan-US partnership, based on shared values and interests, will continue to serve as a cornerstone of regional stability."However, Trump's recent comments have stirred anxiety in Taiwan's chip sector. During an October appearance on The Joe Rogan Experience podcast, Trump accused Taiwan of "stealing" the US chip industry, questioning the island's role in global semiconductor supply chains. His former national security adviser John Bolton notably warned that under a second Trump term, "Taiwan is potentially toast."Despite these tensions, TSMC has affirmed its commitment to its US investments. The world's largest contract chipmaker announced it would continue with its $65 billion investment plan for new factories in Arizona, regardless of Trump's election victory.TSMC has notified Chinese chip design companies that it will suspend production of their most advanced AI chips starting Monday, according to the Financial Times. The world's largest contract chipmaker will no longer manufacture AI chips at advanced process nodes of 7 nanometres or smaller for Chinese customers, with future supplies subject to Washington's approval.According to CNBC, despite Trump's campaign rhetoric against the CHIPS Act, policy experts believe the $53 billion semiconductor initiative will likely remain largely intact, though with possible modifications to fund allocation.While policy experts anticipate the CHIPS Act will survive Trump's return, the semiconductor industry's landscape remains in flux. As both Chinese and Taiwanese chip sectors brace for potential policy shifts, the $53 billion US semiconductor initiative stands as a critical factor in shaping the industry's global future, despite lingering uncertainty about Trump's trade policies.
Article Summary: China's semiconductor industry is gearing up for Donald Trump's return to the White House by accelerating equipment purchases. Trump is expected to take an even tougher stance on China's chip ambitions in his second term. The situation has created ripples in Taiwan, where semiconductor giant TSMC faces uncertainty about its global operations.

Article Title: TikTok ban: From US to Canada here’s a list of countries that have banned TikTok
Article Text:
List of countries where TikTok is banned

Afghanistan: The Taliban banned TikTok in April 2022, citing its “misleading” influence on the country’s youth. The move aligns with Afghanistan’s restrictive cultural policies, where the government exercises strict control over media and content to enforce its societal norms.

Armenia and Azerbaijan: During periods of military tension, including recent border clashes, these two countries have temporarily blocked TikTok. Azerbaijan lifted its most recent ban in October 2023. The temporary bans reflect concerns that the app could be misused for spreading information or propaganda during conflicts.

Australia: TikTok has been banned on government devices in Australia since April 2023. However, the general public can still access and use the app, suggesting that Australia’s primary concern lies in protecting sensitive government data.

Austria, Denmark, and the European Union: Several European nations, including Austria and Denmark, as well as institutions within the European Union, have restricted TikTok on government-issued devices. European security agencies are concerned about the possibility of foreign access to user data, especially with China’s growing influence in technology.

India: India enacted a comprehensive ban on TikTok in 2020 after a deadly border clash with China. The government cited national security as the reason, marking one of the first full-scale bans on the app worldwide. Indian content creators, previously very active on TikTok, moved to other platforms such as YouTube Shorts and Instagram Reels to maintain their audiences.

Indonesia: In October 2023, Indonesia banned TikTok’s “Shop” feature, citing violations of local e-commerce regulations. The country’s selective restriction is an example of how governments may choose to regulate specific functionalities of an app to align with local laws, rather than banning it outright.

Iran and Pakistan: Both countries have intermittently blocked TikTok, often citing social, moral, or ethical concerns. Iran has long restricted internet access to global platforms, including TikTok, as part of broader controls on content that conflicts with its government’s values.

United States: Congress and the U.S. military have barred TikTok from all government devices, and around half of U.S. states have adopted similar restrictions for state-owned devices. The primary concern in the U.S. is foreign access to personal data, as there are fears that the Chinese government could exploit user information for intelligence purposes.

Russia: Although TikTok is still accessible in Russia, users are mainly shown content generated within the country. This restriction reflects Russia’s increasing control over online information and its efforts to limit foreign influence on Russian users.

Other countries: Numerous other nations have enacted restrictions based on their unique concerns. For example, Jordan banned TikTok following civil unrest in December 2022, citing concerns over its use to spread misinformation. In Nepal, a ban was issued in November 2023, and Somalia has also blocked TikTok over concerns about its role in spreading propaganda and extremist content.

Why are countries restricting TikTok?

Also read |

|

|

Canada has recently issued a directive to close TikTok’s offices in Toronto and Vancouver, citing increasing concerns over data privacy and potential foreign influence, specifically in relation to the app’s Chinese ownership. This action reflects a serious response to perceived risks associated with TikTok’s data collection and sharing practices, which have been scrutinised in Canada and internationally. The announcement, made by Canadian officials on Wednesday, underscores the government’s belief that TikTok poses a security threat due to the potential misuse of user data and the influence that foreign entities could exert through the platform.As more countries seek to protect their citizens’ information and limit potential foreign influence, TikTok’s operations and global reach may be further impacted, influencing both the app’s future growth and the broader conversation around data security and privacy on social media platforms.Canada’s move aligns with a growing international trend where countries are imposing bans, restrictions, or partial limitations on TikTok, typically because of privacy concerns, national security, or ethical reasons. Here’s a detailed overview of the actions taken by various countries:Across these regions, governments share common concerns around data privacy, national security, and the platform’s influence on social behaviour. Many governments worry that TikTok’s data-gathering techniques allow it to collect extensive personal information, which could be accessed by foreign entities. Additionally, with TikTok’s growing popularity, there’s a fear of the app being used to shape public opinion, especially in politically sensitive regions. For instance, during conflicts, TikTok could theoretically be leveraged to disseminate propaganda or influence public perception.
Article Summary: The Taliban banned TikTok in Afghanistan in April 2022, citing its ‘misleading’ influence on the country’s youth. India enacted a comprehensive ban on TikTok after a deadly border clash with China in 2020. The U.S. military and Congress have barred TikTok from all government devices. Many European nations, including Austria and Denmark, have restricted TikTok on government-issued devices.

Article Title: Bengaluru traffic police to launch super-app for real-time traffic updates, reporting accidents
Article Text:
Representative Image

What Bengaluru police said about this app



“We want to integrate the Public Eye and other services into a single app. Even the traffic police will start using the app with added features to report road incidents. They (the agency) will make a digital map of the city that we can use to simulate projects such as road closures or changing one-ways without inconveniencing people. If the simulation shows better results, we want to implement those changes.”

“All work orders will be finalised by the end of this month and works will be completed by January,”

Bengaluru commuters may soon have a "one-stop" solution for all traffic updates. The Bengaluru Traffic Police is reportedly planning to launch the ASTraM (Actionable Intelligence for Sustainable Traffic Management) super-app within the next two months. This app will provide real-time traffic congestion updates and will even allow users to report accidents.The app aims to eliminate the need for relying on multiple navigation apps or social media for traffic information. According to a report by Deccan Herald, users will be able to report violations and accidents on this app by submitting images without revealing their personal information.However, this new app will be different from the existing ASTraM app, which is exclusively for traffic police to monitor and analyse traffic patterns. The upcoming public version is expected to cover the entire city, expanding from the current simulation model that covers 21 major traffic corridors.In a statement to Deccan Herald, the Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) M N Anucheth said the new "one-stop" super-app will offer several useful features for commuters, including real-time traffic congestion alerts within a 5-kilometre radius, the ability to report accidents and a convenient way to view and pay traffic fines.JCP Anucheth said:The traffic police will also hire eligible agencies to create microsimulation models of the city within the next three months. This will enable them to model individual vehicle movement to assess the traffic, down to a street level, to manage it better.The Bengaluru Traffic Police's super-app is part of a broader initiative to improve traffic management in the city. This initiative includes various projects, such as procuring new signboards, solar blinkers, body-worn cameras, and cat's eyes to enhance road safety. Tenders for these projects were released in October, and work is currently underway, JCP Anucheth noted.he added.
Article Summary: Bengaluru Traffic Police is reportedly planning to launch the ASTraM super-app within the next two months. This app will provide real-time traffic congestion updates and will even allow users to report accidents. Users will be able to report violations and accidents by submitting images without revealing their personal information.

Article Title: Hackers demands payment in breads after breaching French giant Schneider Electric
Article Text: A newly emerged ransomware group has demanded an unusual ransom from French multinational Schneider Electric : $125,000 worth of baguettes (a bread of French origin), marking one of the most bizarre extortion attempts in recent cybercrime history.The demand would require approximately 58,715 French baguettes, though security experts believe the bread-based ransom is likely a publicity stunt. According to BleepingComputer, the group, known as Hellcat, is actually seeking payment in the privacy-focused cryptocurrency Monero.Schneider Electric, an energy management and industrial automation company, confirmed it is investigating unauthorised access to one of its internal project tracking platforms. "Our Global Incident Response team has been immediately mobilised to respond to the incident," the company stated, emphasising that its products and services remain unaffected.The hackers claim to have prevailed 40GB of compressed data, including over 400,000 rows of user information, after breaching the company's Atlassian Jira system using exposed credentials. BleepingComputer reports that the stolen data contains approximately 75,000 unique email addresses and full names of employees and customers.Hellcat, previously known as the International Contract Agency before rebranding, has offered to halve the ransom if Schneider Electric publicly acknowledges the breach. The group's spokesperson, who goes by "Grep," indicated they are currently testing an encryptor for future attacks.Last month, Japanese electronics company Casio confirmed that a ransomware attack in October resulted in the theft of customer data, as well as sensitive employee and company information.
Article Summary: A newly emerged ransomware group has demanded an unusual ransom from French multinational Schneider Electric. The demand would require approximately 58,715 French baguettes, though security experts believe the bread-based ransom is likely a publicity stunt. The group, known as Hellcat, is actually seeking payment in the privacy-focused cryptocurrency Monero.

Article Title: New brand Anphonic launched, aims to offer personalised shopper experience to retailers using AI-enabled tools and solutions
Article Text: Anphonic, a new brand that claims to be strategic growth partner for D2C companies, launched this week. The company offers solutions that provide personalized AI-driven shopping experiences. "With a seamless low-code, no-code integration that goes live in just 15 minutes, Anphonic transforms shopper interactions into growth opportunities," said the com[any in a release.In the highly challenging and complex world of direct-to-consumer (D2C) brands, scaling has become more challenging than ever. Rising customer acquisition costs (CAC), stagnant average order values (AOV), and low conversion rates are stifling growth for even the most innovative brands. More than 80% of retail consumers state that they want and expect personalised experiences, according to a BCG survey of 5,000 global consumers. However, two-thirds have experienced personalisation that is inappropriate, inaccurate, or intrusive. These challenges demand more than just a quick fix—they require a transformation.Anphonic aims to meet this need. Anphonic’s solutions are designed to empower D2C brands to create personalised journeys that build lasting shopper relationships while boosting AOV and retention. In a matter of days, Anphonic has made a significant impact on its partners - achieving a 15% increase in average order value, contributing 30% to total sales, and delivering 9.41% of sales driven by AI-powered product discovery .“We simplify the shopper journey at every stage,” said Vicky Kukreja, Founder & CEO of Anphonic. “We’re not just a tech provider— we are a strategic growth partner, committed to ensuring every solution delivers positive ROI. We work closely with brands to understand their needs and design customised solutions based on their requirements. I’m highly excited about the prospects of Anphonic and our team’s expertise in providing world-class solutions.”"We’re not waiting for the future of retail—we’re building it,” adds Kukreja.
Article Summary: Anphonic, a new brand that claims to be strategic growth partner for D2C companies, launched this week. The company offers solutions that provide personalized AI-driven shopping experiences. More than 80% of retail consumers state that they want and expect personalised experiences, according to a BCG survey.

Article Title: 'Coffee gives a high', and how Intel's HR agrees to this
Article Text:
What Intel said

Intel to cut 15,000 jobs

Intel is reintroducing free coffee for employees in an effort to boost morale and foster a more positive workplace atmosphere. According to The Oregonian report, the chipmaker informed its employees last week that it will bring back free coffee and tea at its work sites. The company eliminated free coffee and tea last summer as it sought to slash $10 billion from its annual budget.In an internal messaging forum Circuity, Intel wrote “Although Intel still faces cost challenges, we understand that small comforts play a significant role in our daily routines.”“We know this is a small step, but we hope it is a meaningful one in supporting our workplace culture.”At an all-company meeting last week, Intel’s chief people officer, Christy Pambianchi informed employees that the company had been spending $100 million each year on free and discounted food and drinks, a cost it could no longer sustain. “Until we get into a better financial health position, we need to be suspending those,” Pambianchi said, according to an account of the meeting reviewed by The Oregonian. Other benefits like complimentary fruits remain suspended.In August, Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger announced plans to eliminate over 15,000 jobs globally and reduce costs by more than $10 billion. The company aims to streamline operations in response to worsening financial conditions and increased competition in the semiconductor industry. It informed employees that benefits like eliminating or reducing reimbursements for internet, phone, and commuting costs will be cut.As part of this, Intel initiated layoffs affecting over 2,000 jobs in multiple US states. An Intel spokesperson then confirmed that these job cuts are necessary steps to create "a leaner, simpler, and more agile company" positioned for long-term sustainable growth.
Article Summary: Intel is reintroducing free coffee for employees in an effort to boost morale and foster a more positive workplace atmosphere. The company eliminated free coffee and tea last summer as it sought to slash $10 billion from its annual budget. In August, Intel CEO Pat Gelsinger announced plans to eliminate over 15,000 jobs globally.

Article Title: Microsoft founder Bill Gates congratulates Donald Trump: ‘I hope we can work together now….’
Article Text:
Take a look at

post

Bill Gates reportedly made donations to Kamala Harris

Other Tech CEOs wish Trump

Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates is the latest tech mogul to congratulate Republican Party’s Donald Trump, acknowledging his recent victory and expressing hope for future collaboration. Gates joins other prominent figures in recognizing the new president, signaling potential opportunities for innovation and progress on global challenges under Trump's leadership.In his message, he also congratulated vice president elect JD Vance. Taking to microblogging X (formerly Twitter), Gates wrote “Congratulations to President Trump and VP-elect Vance. America is at its strongest when we use ingenuity and innovation to improve lives here in the U.S. and around the world. I hope we can work together now to build a brighter future for everyone.”As per a New York Times report, Gates donated more than $50 million to a non-profit that supported Kamala Harris. His ex-wife Melinda French Gates publicly endorsed Democrat’s Kamala Harris during the election campaigns, calling her the “right candidate, right now".Tech CEOs including Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg, Apple CEO Tim Cook and OpenAI CEO Sam Altman extended their wishes to Trump on his win. Mark Zuckerberg congratulated Trump saying “Congratulations to President Trump on a decisive victory. We have great opportunities ahead as a country. Looking forward to working with you and your administration.”“Congratulations President Trump on your victory! We look forward to engaging with you and your administration to help make sure the United States continues to lead with and be fueled by ingenuity, innovation, and creativity,” Tim Cook wrote in an X post. Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella said “Congratulations President Trump, we’re looking forward to engaging with you and your administration to drive innovation forward that creates new growth and opportunity for the United States and the world.”
Article Summary: Gates joins other prominent figures in recognizing the new president, signaling potential opportunities for innovation and progress on global challenges. His ex-wife Melinda French Gates publicly endorsed Democrat’s Kamala Harris during the election campaigns, calling her the “right candidate, right now”

Article Title: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos’s net worth hits record high after Donald Trump’s victory
Article Text:
Amazon founder congratulates Trump

Amazon founder Jeff Bezos’s net worth has hit an all-time high of $228 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index . That is a $7 billion increase from his previous peak of $221 billion, first achieved in July and matched again on Tuesday. The rise is attributed to an increase in Amazon’s stock. Majority of Bezos' wealth is tied to Amazon’s stock. He holds more than 926 million shares, amounting to just under 9% of the company.Amazon's stock had already gained over 40% this year. Amazon's stock price approached $200 per share last week on a strong earnings report. The stocks jumped further after Donald Trump’s win on Tuesday, closing at a record-high share price of $207.09 on Wednesday. This surge helped drive the Nasdaq 100 index, where Amazon is listed, to a new peak.Bezos is said to have had a rocky relationship with Trump. Late last month, Bezos defended the Washington Post’s (which he owns) decision of not endorsing a single US Presidential candidate. He asserted that political endorsements eventually create a perception of bias.Amazon founder and Executive Chairman Jeff Bezos celebrated Trump’s win in a post on X, calling it an “extraordinary political comeback and decisive victory,” wrote Bezos."Big congratulations to our 45th and now 47th President on an extraordinary political comeback and decisive victory. No nation has bigger opportunities. Wishing @realDonaldTrump all success in leading and uniting the America we all love," wrote Bezos.
Article Summary: Jeff Bezos' net worth has hit an all-time high of $228 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. That is a $7 billion increase from his previous peak of $221 billion, first achieved in July and matched again on Tuesday. The rise is attributed to an increase in Amazon’s stock.

Article Title: Microsoft starts rolling out AI to these decades old popular tools on Windows
Article Text:
Representational

Paint gets a generative AI boost

Notepad gets AI for rewriting

Microsoft is bringing artificial intelligence (AI) prowess to nearly 40-year-old products: Paint and Notepad. The company has announced new AI experiences for Paint and Notepad to Windows Insiders in the Canary and Dev Channels on Windows 11, aimed at enhancing creativity and productivity.Paint is receiving two major AI-powered additions: Generative Fill and Generative EraseGenerative Fill will allow users to add or modify elements within an image simply by describing what they want using text prompts. By selecting an area and providing a description, users can generate new content that blends with the existing image style.For example, users can ask the AI to make a mediaeval castle in the selected area of Windows XP wallpaper, and it will create one. This feature is initially available on Snapdragon-powered Copilot+ PCs.Generative Erase will enable users to remove unwanted objects from an image. By selecting the object to be erased, the AI intelligently fills in the surrounding area, making it look like the object was never there. This feature is available to all Windows 11 users.In addition to these new features, Microsoft is also improving the performance and expanding the availability of existing AI capabilities in Paint, such as Cocreator and Image Creator.Notepad, the simple text editor, is also getting a significant AI upgrade. The Rewrite feature will allow users to rephrase sentences, adjust the tone and even modify the length of their text using AI. By selecting the text they want to rewrite, users can generate multiple variations and choose the one that best suits their needs. This feature is available in preview to all Windows 11 users in select regions.“We have also continued to improve Notepad launch performance. With this update, most users will see app launch time improve by more than 35%, with some users seeing improvements of 55% or more,” the company said.
Article Summary: Paint is receiving two major AI-powered additions: Generative Fill and Generative Erase. Notepad, the simple text editor, is also getting a significant AI upgrade. The Rewrite feature will allow users to rephrase sentences, adjust the tone and even modify the length of their text using AI.

Article Title: Roblox, the gaming company ‘charged’ by Hindenburg Research, is bringing these two updates
Article Text:
Two changes that Roblox is bringing to protect minors

Roblox , the popular online gaming platform that has faced scrutiny over allegations of misleading investors and concerns about children's exposure to inappropriate content, is implementing changes to address these issues.In a post on Roblox developers forum, the company has announced that it is “updating experience guideline policies to keep our younger users safe.” A report by Hindenburg Research in October highlighted the presence of sexually explicit content within the platform, raising concerns about child safety.Roblox has denied the charges.Roblox said that it is bringing two changes on the platform: Unrated experiences non-accessible and restricting access to social hangouts to users under 13.By default, users under the age of 13 will not be able to play, search, and discover unrated experiences. This will ensure that parents and users have more clarity into the types of content available on Roblox and will help them make more informed choices about what they want to play.We will be restricting access to Social Hangouts and Free-form User Creation experiences to users ages 13+.This means that starting December 3, Roblox will require creators to complete a questionnaire for each experience they wish to make available to users under 13. This questionnaire will help ensure that all experiences accessible to young users are age-appropriate and meet Roblox's community standards.As a result of this change, any unrated experiences will be hidden from search results and recommendations for users under 13. These users will still be able to access these experiences via direct link, but they will no longer be easily discoverable.The second big change is restricting social hangouts and free-form user creation for users under 13. Starting November 18, experiences featuring social hangouts and free-form 2D user creation will only be available to users 13 and older.This restriction applies to experiences where the primary purpose is socialising and communicating with other users, such as “vibe games” and virtual clubs.
Article Summary: Roblox is bringing two changes on the platform: Unrated experiences non- accessible and restricting access to social hangouts to users under 13. A report by Hindenburg Research in October highlighted the presence of sexually explicit content within the platform, raising concerns about child safety.

Article Title: Nissan to cut 9,000 jobs globally after net income drops by 94%; CEO accepts these 'big problems'
Article Text:
What is hurting Nissan big time

Nissan CEO: We cannot deny ...

Japan's third-largest auto company Nissan Motor Corp. has announced a drastic overhaul of its global operations, aiming to regain lost ground in the rapidly evolving electric and hybrid vehicle markets. The Japanese automaker will eliminate 9,000 jobs and reduce production capacity by 20%. CEO Makoto Uchida will also take a 50% pay cut.The restructuring cost-cutting measures come after Nissan's net income plummeted 94% in the first half. Nissan will also sell off some of its stake in Mitsubishi Motors Corp after burning through ¥448.3 billion ($2.9 billion) in cash during the last six months. The company's operating income is down 70% from its previous forecast. Management also lowered their revenue outlook by more than 9%, meaning they now expect virtually no growth for the year.Nissan President and CEO Makoto Uchida said: “These turnaround measures do not imply that the company is shrinking. Nissan will restructure its business to become leaner and more resilient, while also reorganizing management to respond quickly and flexibly to changes in the business environment. We aim to enhance the competitiveness of our products, which are fundamental to our success, and set Nissan back on a path of growth. As a cohesive team, we are dedicated to working together to ensure the successful implementation of our plans.”The CEO reportedly told investors that Nissan has been affected “not only by external challenges, but also by our specific issues,” alluding both to the breakneck rise of Chinese automakers and Nissan setting overly ambitious sales targets.Like many traditional automakers, Nissan has struggled to adapt to shifting consumer preferences. In China, domestic brands like BYD have capitalized on the surge in EV demand, while in the U.S., hybrid vehicles are gaining popularity, favoring competitors like Toyota.Uchida acknowledged the company's missteps, stating, "We cannot deny that our sales plan was overstretched." To address these challenges, Nissan will invest in its EV lineup in China and expand its hybrid offerings in the U.S. The company also plans to leverage partnerships, such as its recent tie-up with Honda, to streamline production and reduce costs.With these aggressive measures, Nissan aims to secure a more competitive position in the global automotive market. However, the road ahead remains uncertain as the industry continues to undergo rapid transformation.
Article Summary: Nissan Motor Corp. has announced a drastic overhaul of its global operations. The Japanese automaker will eliminate 9,000 jobs and reduce production capacity by 20%. CEO Makoto Uchida will also take a 50% pay cut. The restructuring cost- cutting measures come after Nissan's net income plummeted 94% in the first half.

Article Title: 4 Big reasons Indian IT sector is 'happy' with Donald Trump's return despite likely tougher H-1B visa and immigration laws
Article Text:
So what is it that is pepping up the mood in favour of Indian IT companies?

Here are four likely factors



* Strong dollar:

* Stability in policymaking:

* Better tax policies for corporations:

* Alternative to China:

India's information technology (IT) sector is upbeat about President Donald Trump’s return to the Oval Office. The mood is high despite concerns over potential changes to US immigration laws. Immigration experts and analysts have warned that Trump may go stricter on H-1B and other immigration laws during his second tenure as the US President.Donald Trump's previous term saw an increase in salaries for H1B workers as well as visa fee. In this term, the Trump administration may reconsider the annual allotment of H1B work visas, currently capped at 85,000. H1B applications could face tougher scrutiny, as denial rates under the previous Trump administration reached an all-time high of 24%. The duration and eligibility for Optional Practical Training (OPT) for international students may also come under review.Despite these concerns, India’s IT companies celebrated the Republican victory as tech stocks led the rally on India’s benchmark stock indices. IT stocks appreciated sharply, fueling a rally in the benchmark indices after it became clear that Donald Trump will take over as the next US president for the second term. Shares of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) surged 4.21 per cent, Infosys jumped 4.02 per cent, Tech Mahindra soared 3.85 per cent, and HCL Technologies climbed 3.71 per cent on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Also, Persistent Systems zoomed 5.86 per cent, LTIMindtree jumped 4.75 percent, and Wipro advanced 3.75 per cent.IT companies expect easier finance policies around interest rates, inflation etc., which may help loosen IT budgets of US companies. A stronger dollar benefits the Indian outsourcing industry, as a majority of the IT services companies cater to the US as a key business market. Thereby, the industry derives a large part of their revenue in US currency though their operational costs are in Indian rupees.With Republicans controlling the government, Senate, and Congress, there is likely to be stability in policy making.Donald Trump's proposal to cut the corporate tax rate from 21% to 15% is likely to ease budgetary pressures and expand discretionary tech spending by US companies and thus benefiting Indian startups registered in the US as well as technology companies.Donald Trump's tough stance towards China means increased US fund flow to India. Trump is expected to play hardball with China, as seen during his last tenure. This will benefit Indian IT companies from a higher degree of fund flow. Advanced technologies like artificial intelligence (AI) and semiconductors may see more of US investments.World's richest man Elon Musk's net worth also increased significantly after the Republican candidate and former US president Donald Trump won the elections. Musk has been a vocal supporter of Trump and his wealth surged due to a rise in his companies' share prices following the election results.
Article Summary: India's information technology (IT) sector is upbeat about President Donald Trump’s return to the Oval Office. The mood is high despite concerns over potential changes to US immigration laws. Immigration experts and analysts have warned that Trump may go stricter on H-1B and other immigration laws during his second tenure.

Article Title: Gurugram sprinkles artificial rain to combat air pollution
Article Text: A unique approach to combating air pollution was taken by the Resident Welfare Association (RWA) of DLF Primus Society in Sector 82, Gurugram. On Thursday, November 8, the RWA conducted " artificial rain " by spraying water from the fire lines of the society's 32-storey high-rise towers.Achal Yadav, the RWA President, told news agency ANI that this initiative is aimed at reducing air pollution in the area. "We are ready to conduct artificial rain daily if the Air Quality Index (AQI) in Gurugram worsens," he said.The RWA has also implemented additional measures like carpooling to contribute to cleaner air. "The government alone cannot solve this issue. Everyone needs to participate," Yadav added.Meanwhile, the Central government has introduced amendments to the Commission for Air Quality Management in the National Capital Region and Adjoining Areas Rules of 2023 to address the problem of stubble burning. The new rules impose environmental compensation on farmers who engage in stubble burning.As per the notification released by the Union Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate change, the central government aims to impose new rules to deal with the stubble burning in Delhi and surrounding areas.Farmers with less than two acres of land will be charged Rs 5,000, those with two to five acres will pay Rs 10,000, and those with more than five acres will pay Rs 30,000. These measures are being implemented in response to the alarming rise in air pollution levels in Delhi and its surrounding areas, with the AQI frequently exceeding 400.
Article Summary: Resident Welfare Association (RWA) of DLF Primus Society in Sector 82, Gurugram sprayed water from the fire lines of the society's 32-storey high-rise towers. The initiative is aimed at reducing air pollution in the area. The RWA has also implemented additional measures like carpooling to contribute to cleaner air.

Article Title: GenWise launches first UPI payment solution tailored for senior citizen
Article Text: GenWise, India’s leading app-based club for senior citizens, has launched an industry-first UPI payment solution specifically designed to address the needs of India’s elderly population. Developed in collaboration with Axis Bank, GenWise UPI features an intuitive, simplified interface, emphasizing security measures such as geo-fencing, biometric authentication, and audio-based navigation—all tailored to help elders use digital payments comfortably and confidently.Despite UPI’s widespread adoption in India, with over 400 million active users and 16.5 billion transactions recorded in October alone, a significant portion of India’s 250 million seniors remain hesitant due to the complexity of most payment apps. However, with smartphone penetration at over 65% among seniors, GenWise UPI aims to tap into this segment and make digital payments accessible. The platform’s unique features include UPI Lite and Mobile Number Mapper, which allow elders to make transactions without sharing personal bank details or primary phone numbers, addressing their privacy concerns.Nalin Bansal, Chief of Fintechs and New Initiatives at NPCI, praised the initiative, calling it a step toward broader financial inclusion, while Sanjeev Moghe of Axis Bank highlighted the secure, reliable infrastructure underpinning GenWise’s UPI solution. GenWise founder Nehul Malhotra shared ambitious plans to reach 20 million Indian seniors in the next two years through nationwide awareness sessions, with the company also developing retirement and wealth management tools tailored to this demographic.This groundbreaking UPI launch by GenWise signals a new era of financial empowerment for India’s elders, offering them a secure, user-friendly digital payment experience.
Article Summary: GenWise, India’s leading app-based club for senior citizens, has launched an industry-first UPI payment solution. Developed in collaboration with Axis Bank, GenWise UPI features an intuitive, simplified interface, emphasizing security measures such as geo-fencing and biometric authentication.

Article Title: UPI, RBI rules ...: Why Banks are shutting down ATMs
Article Text:
RBI mandate for ATMs

Despite a record-high cash circulation, India's banks are reportedly increasingly phasing out ATMs and cash recyclers. According to a report in Economic Times, this shift is driven by the growing popularity of digital payments, particularly UPI, and a strategic focus on digital transformation.According to RBI data, the number of ATMs in India decreased from 219,000 in September 2023 to 215,000 in September 2024. This decline is primarily due to a significant reduction in off-site ATMs, which fell from a peak of 97,072 in September 2022 to 87,638 in September 2024.Ravi B Goyal, chairman of AGS Transact Technologies, told the publication, "The recent trends in ATM deployment reflect a shifting focus in India's banking sector as it navigates the dynamic landscape of consolidation, digital transformation and expansion into underserved regions." He added, "In recent years, public sector bank consolidation has led to more optimised networks, blending physical and digital infrastructure."While cash still plays a significant role in India's economy, accounting for 89% of transactions in FY22 and 12% of GDP, ATM penetration remains low with only 15 ATMs per 100,000 people. Factors such as RBI regulations on free ATM transactions, interoperability, and interchange fees have further discouraged ATM investments.Industry experts predict that India will adopt a global model of two ATMs per branch, one on-site and one off-site, as banks continue to balance physical and digital infrastructure to meet the evolving needs of their customers.
Article Summary: India's banks are reportedly phasing out ATMs and cash recyclers. This shift is driven by the growing popularity of digital payments, particularly UPI. The number of ATMs in India decreased from 219,000 in September 2023 to 215,000.
